text: I was born in a house with a garden no one could fix.
My mother tried and spent hours digging, watering, trimming dead stems, ...but nothing ever grew.
Even the roses withered after blooming.

speaker: Alice
text: Why won’t the flowers stay?

speaker: Mother
text: Some things aren’t meant to grow here.
Back then, I didn’t know what sadness looked like in adults. I just thought everyone was tired.
But the garden was a warning.
A warning of noise and silence.
It wasn’t just the plants that faded. Something else was wilting inside that house, too.
Everything that touched that house died slowly. Not a single resident escaped their fates of being silenced.
The garden is the start of life, yet it can also be the resting place of the dead. A flower is wilting.

choices.text: Crush the flower under her shoe
choices.goto: Crush the flower under her shoe

speaker: Alice
text: Maybe it just needs a second chance.

speaker: Alice
text: Even if it's wilting... there's still life left in it.

speaker: Alice
text: After all, this garden is very beautiful.

speaker: Alice
text: Maybe it can be beautiful again.
The soil drank greedily. For a moment, I thought I saw the petals lift just slightly.

anchor: Crush the flower under her shoe

speaker: Alice
text: They always die anyway.

speaker: Alice
text: No matter how much you care for them...

speaker: Alice
text: They just wilt, rot, and drag everything else down with them.

speaker: Alice
text: It’s better this way. Mercy through certainty.
The crunch was soft. The silence afterward was louder.
A Lady came to the mansion.
She wore red lipstick that left stains on glasses and a perfume that lingered too long after she left the room.
She laughed at things no one else found funny and smiled too widely, like someone who wanted you to trust her more than she deserved.
She was introduced as mother’s “friend.”
At first, she started staying late.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I watched her pour wine for Father. He smiled back. Mother looked away.
And then she started staying overnight.
Then every day.

speaker: Alice
text: Is Aunty Rosa gonna live with us now?

speaker: Mother
text: She’s just helping out for a while. That’s all.
But mother wasn't certain. She was never certain when she was near Rosa.
Sometimes I caught Rosa staring out at the garden. Like she was waiting for it to bloom-or for it to bury something.
After Rosa's frequent visits mother smiled less. She moved quietly, as though trying not to draw attention to herself.
At the table, she barely ate, barely spoke.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Father has also changed.
His anger softened not into kindness, but into obedience.
He stood straighter around Rosa. He drank less, but stared longer. His tone was also careful.
It was like everyone had become actors in someone else’s play. No one knew their lines anymore.
I remembered hearing mother once whispering to the neighbor through the fence.

speaker: Mother
text: He’s always looking at younger girls. Barely adults, some of them. It’s like... he wants someone who’ll never talk back.
I didn’t understand the words back then.
But later, when Rosa moved in, it all started to make sense.
Mother was upset. And Rosa, she was speaking with one of the attendants.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I’ll stay near Mom. She’s not okay.

speaker: Mother
text: Alice...

speaker: Alice
text: You looked like you needed someone.

speaker: Mother
text: They always talked about me. Like I couldn't hear them.

speaker: Alice
text: They shouldn't. It’s... wrong.

speaker: Mother
text: Thank you dear.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: She seems calmer. I’m glad I stayed.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: If I try to please her… maybe she’ll be nice.

speaker: Alice
text: Lady-

speaker: Rosa
text: Don’t interrupt when adults are speaking, dear.

speaker: Rosa
text: Only speak when spoken to.

speaker: Rosa
text: And never, ever talk back.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I just called out. Just a word. But she looks at me like I broke something.
I used to think that grown-ups knew what was right. That silence meant peace.
After that day, things got worse for my mother. Was this all planned, I don't even know. No one will know. Because this garden holds the noise of the residents.

speaker: Alice
text: What happened to your face?

speaker: Rosa
text: Oh, sweetheart... your mommy just tripped. She’s clumsy like that.

speaker: Rosa
text: But don’t worry! adults fix these things. You don’t need to get involved. Just be a good girl, alright?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Her eyes didn’t match her words. They looked like glass left out in the rain— about to crack.
Suffering was what awaited those of us who lived under the same roof as her. Not a single day passed where we didn't see her.
*Inaudible Noises*

speaker: Alice Mind
text: We don't belong here.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: She's always here...

speaker: Rosa
text: Sit up straight. Slouching makes you look weak.

speaker: Rosa
text: And chew with your mouth closed this time. Children who chew too loudly grow up to be pigs.

speaker: Alice
text: ...Can I have the crayons after dinner?

speaker: Rosa
text: No. You left them lying around last time. Don’t ask again.

speaker: Alice
text: I’ll be careful-

speaker: Rosa
text: I said no.

speaker: Mother
text: Please excuse me.

speaker: Rosa
text: Your mother was always soft. It’s why things fell apart before I came. You don’t want to end up like her, do you?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: She wants me to be silent. Like the garden. Like the house… But something in me is starting to grow again.
My drawings can be seen on the wall. The silent pictures of monsters with long arms and mouths full of thorns, each one of them representing the residents of this place.
Each stroke was a scream I couldn't voice. Each figure, a memory they forced me to forget.

speaker: Alice
text: You see me, right? You didn’t forget me?

speaker: Alice
text: Sometimes I think they watch me through the cracks. Like they’re waiting for me to stop.

speaker: Alice
text: If I keep drawing, they’ll know I’m still here. But... if I tear them down, what’s left of me?

speaker: Alice
text: If no one will hear me, then I’ll make sure they see me.
I press the charcoal harder, the lines darker—deeper. The figure on the wall grows more vivid.

speaker: Alice
text: I shouldn’t have done that. I might make things worse.
The torn paper flutters to the floor like shed skin. The wall behind it feels colder.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Is someone out in the hallway?
The voices are muffled, like old recordings buried under dust.
You’re too soft on her.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: It's father?

speaker: Father
text: She’s spoiled. Doesn’t listen.

speaker: Father
text: She’s just like her mother. Always crying, always pretending to be the victim.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: It's too loud.
I tried to step away-but my foot caught the edge of the table.
I accidentally hit the vase.

speaker: Father
text: Goddammit, Alice! Can’t you do anything right!?

speaker: Father
text: Clean it up. Now. Before I lose my patience.
My hands trembled as I reached for the broken pieces. Sharp edges. Cold floor.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Why does it always feel like I'm the one in pieces?

choices.text: Remember who he used to be
choices.goto: Remember who he used to be

anchor: Remember who he used to be

speaker: Alice Mind
text: You used to hold my hand when I was scared... where did you go?
For a moment, the anger fades. But only for a moment.

speaker: Alice
text: You’re not my dad anymore. You’re just noise.
He steps forward, but I don’t flinch. Not this time.
Shouting echoed through the house like thunder. I pressed my hands over my ears and went back to my room.
I thought it would stop-but the voices followed me like shadows.

speaker: Mother
text: What's happening here?

speaker: Father
text: You think I don’t know what’s going on? You and her, whispering behind my back like I’m some fool!

speaker: Father
text: This is my house!

speaker: Alice Mind
text: He's at it again. When will the noise stop?

speaker: Father
text: ENOUGH! I'VE HAD ENOUGH OF YOU!
A silence thicker than rage filled the air.

speaker: Mother
text: Just what... went wrong?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: It's over

speaker: Mother
text: ...I've also had enough.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Mom... are you also leaving?
I heared my mother leaving, soft sounds of crying could be heared when she left. I stayed in my room for several hours.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I should check the bathroom... just to clear my head.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Running water?

speaker: Alice
text: Mom?

speaker: Alice
text: Are you okay?
The door is locked. Steam seeps from beneath it. But no footsteps. No reply.

speaker: Alice
text: Why aren't you answering...?
Through the keyhole, a pale hand. Water overflows. A shape unmoving.

speaker: Alice
text: No... no no no...
...Words couldn't describe the horrors of that day.

speaker: Alice
text: It's over, it's all over. Noise will take over.

speaker: Alice
text: What can I do now?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I’ll remember her. I won’t let her go.
Her voice still echoes when I close my eyes. A lullaby caught in the walls.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: If I forget it, maybe it’ll stop hurting.
But the silence won't let me. It remembers everything I try to erase.
Where trust is broken and silence begins, the suffering seemed endless.

speaker: Alice
text: Huh?
Something cold against my foot. A small glint on the carpet.

speaker: Alice
text: A ring?

speaker: Alice
text: Was it mom's?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Whatever, I'll keep it for now.
Sound of footsteps approaching from the hallway-fast, angry.

speaker: Rosa
text: Where is it!?

speaker: Rosa
text: You!

speaker: Alice
text: W-what?

speaker: Rosa
text: The ring. The one your father gave me. Don’t play dumb, you little thief!

speaker: Alice
text: I-I didn’t take it. I found it and-

speaker: Rosa
text: Your father isn’t going to believe a word you say, so you might as well give up!

speaker: Alice Mind
text: How annoying.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: How noisy.
Footsteps echo in hallway.

speaker: Rosa
text: DEAR! THIS CHILD STOLE THE RING YOU GAVE ME!

speaker: Father
text: What!?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: How noisy.

speaker: Rosa
text: I found it gone after cleaning. She admitted she had it.
Father storms into the hall, eyes burning with rage.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: How noisy.

speaker: Father
text: YOU BRAT!! AS EXPECTED OF A CHILD BORN FROM THAT TRASH!
I turned and ran.

speaker: Father
text: COME BACK HERE!

speaker: Alice
text: So noisy.

speaker: Alice
text: If I can’t say it... I’ll show it.
I reach for my sketchbook and pull open a box of crayons. Hands shaking slightly, I began to draw.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: No one believes me. They never will.
I look at my drawings, eyes full of pain. Then I began tearing them slowly—one by one.
I hide the scraps beneath my bed, then turn away to face the wall.
The attic was dark. Damp.
Dust and insulation drifted like snow in the air.
A place I was most familiar with…
A place where I would be staying for the rest of my days.

speaker: Rosa
text: No more crying at the table. No more sulking. If you want to act like a problem, you’ll be treated like one.
A heavy door slams shut. A bolt slides into place.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Don’t open the door.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Don’t trust her.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: I’m not bad. I’m not bad. I’m not bad.

speaker: Alice
text: Pfft- HAHAHAHAHA
A soft wind brushes my cheek-though there is no window.
Alice... don’t fall asleep... she’s in your dreams...

speaker: Alice
text: Are you scared, too?

speaker: Alice
text: It’s okay. I’ll protect you.
The attic is still. Shadows stretch across splintered wood. I sit with my knees pulled to my chest.
You’re the problem…
She doesn’t want you to remember…
You are also a noise...

speaker: Alice
text: That voice again... but it’s closer now.

speaker: Alice
text: She’s still with me. She didn’t leave.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: If I close my eyes… I can almost hear her humming.

speaker: Alice
text: Tell me what I’m not supposed to know.
I sat there with a pained and hopeless expression.
Where silence becomes permanent, this young lady left the world behind to reclaim her noise.
The attic flickers with a surreal dimness. Reality feels thin.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Some...one...
A voice bleeds through from nowhere - muffled, warped.
Aft... Hence the reason we...
A barely tangible voice can be heard. Whispering layered beneath.

speaker: Alice
text: Help me... please...

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Help... me.
This is the final chapter of my story.
Rosa enters with a tea tray, her face cheerful.

speaker: Rosa
text: Oh dear, I brought tea, little ghost.
She sets it down on a dusty table near me, as I sit curled up.

speaker: Rosa
text: You’ve been so quiet. That’s good. Quiet girls don’t get punished.

speaker: Alice
text: Why won’t anyone believe me?

speaker: Rosa
text: Because you were born broken. Like your mother.
My fists tighten.
Silence lingers. Rosa walks slowly around Alice.

speaker: Rosa
text: Do you know how easy it is to make people forget someone like you?
I glare. Rosa turns her head toward the shadows.

speaker: Rosa
text: Heinz, would you be a dear and eliminate the one in front of me?
A tall figure- Heinz- emerges from the dark.

speaker: Alice
text: You found me...

speaker: Heinz
text: Don’t be scared

speaker: Alice
text: Why?

speaker: Heinz
text: You weren’t supposed to last this long.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Then why did I? Why can’t I just be at peace? Why won’t the noises leave?! What did I do to deserve this?!
Alice grabs her head. The world trembles slightly.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: Why? Why? Why? Why? Why? Why!? Why!? WHY!?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: That damn noise won't stop. WHY?!?

speaker: Alice Mind
text: WHY!? WON'T IT STOP!
The air becomes still. The floor creaks
...It is over.

speaker: Rosa
text: No more crying. No more noise.
Silence approaches like the night, still for but a moment.
Until it is taken over by noise, the constant of this young lady's world.
I sat still. Heinz stands behind me.

speaker: Heinz
text: Are you not going to keep struggling?

speaker: Heinz
text: Have gone mute after all you've been through?

speaker: Heinz
text: Huh?

speaker: Alice
text: Noise.

speaker: Alice
text: I can only hear the most beautiful of noises.
A gentle, dark void surrounds me. Me eyes burn bright with calm fury.

speaker: Alice
text: They won’t forget me. I’ll show them what they let happen.
My mind is filled with static. my voice is a scream, calm and sharp.

speaker: Alice Mind
text: They let me die. Let them all burn.
A distant, echoing wail lingers in the air. Citizens are talking in hushed voices.

speaker: Townsperson
text: Did you hear that again last night? Like someone crying under the floorboards?

speaker: Shopkeeper
text: Every night since that place burned down...
A noble nods to Rosa, who sips tea by the fountain.

speaker: Noble
text: Haven’t seen that little girl in a while. She alright?

speaker: Rosa
text: She’s fine. Just needed... structure. Therapy. You know how some children are.

speaker: Rosa
text: Best thing for everyone.
A brief flicker of darkness. Her calm expression fractures.

speaker: Rosa Mind
text: She should be gone. She should be gone...

speaker: Rosa Mind
text: No one will find what I buried.

A new story opens for others. The beginning of theirs is my end. I feel no resentment for the start of their story, their noise. but the end of one noise... is something that has gathered all my resentment.
A man in a trench coat looks over the town, arms crossed.
Edelweiss...
It seems this case is much more difficult to solve than I thought it would be.
The man’s train of thought was interrupted by a KRIMINALPOLIZEI officer calling his name

speaker: Kriminalpolizei
text: Clarence!

speaker: Clarence
text: Hm?

speaker: Kriminalpolizei
text: Don't forget what you came here for. Quit running around the place!

speaker: Clarence
text: Hmph, you Kriminalpolizei can't even do your jobs properly.

speaker: Clarence
text: Had to reach out even to a criminal to solve your cases

speaker: Kriminalpolizei
text: Tsk.

speaker: Clarence
text: Alice Briar Edelweiss, her case that even the most competent investigator can't solve.

speaker: Clarence
text: How very interesting.

speaker: Clarence
text: Let's go.

speaker: Kriminalpolizei
text: Where do you want to go now?

speaker: Clarence
text: The Datura Alyssum.

speaker: Alice
text: Rosa, my dear Rosa, Your noise doesn’t belong in this beautiful garden.
